meanings.definition: To adapt (a story, event, etc.) into a dramatic form.
meanings.sent1: The students dramatised the fairy tale for the school play.
meanings.sent2: She dramatised the historical event to make it suitable for the stage.
meanings.sent3: The children dramatised their bedtime routine, pretending it was a grand performance.
meanings.sent4: His retelling of the incident was so dramatised that it felt like a blockbuster movie.
meanings.sent5: The actor's performance truly dramatised the emotions of the character.

meanings.definition: To make (something) seem more interesting or exciting than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The marketing team dramatised the product features to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: She always dramatised her stories to captivate her audience.
meanings.sent3: The chef dramatised the simple dish as if it were a gourmet masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her exaggerated gestures dramatised the mundane task of folding laundry.
meanings.sent5: The news anchor dramatised the weather report to create suspense.
